snippet: What began as a largely American problem for Takata is taking on widening proportions, involving drivers and regulators in multiple countries.
abstract: Faulty airbags from Japanese supplier Takata are problem that is taking on widening proportions, moving beyond American borders and involving drivers and regulators in multiple countries; one fatality has occurred in Malaysia, in addition to four previous deaths in United States; company's executives have shied away from addressing crisis.

byline.original: By NEIL GOUGH, JONATHAN SOBLE and HIROKO TABUCHI
byline.contributor: Neil Gough reported from Sibu, Jonathan Soble from Tokyo and Hiroko Tabuchi from New York. Rachel Abrams contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: What began as a largely American problem for Takata is taking on widening proportions, involving drivers and regulators in multiple countries.

headline.main: Defective Takata Airbag Grows Into Global Problem for Manufacturer
headline.print_headline: Defective Airbag Grows Into Global Problem for Manufacturer
